reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lord this is good
reviews.reviewText: I’m buying this for my daughters.I’m probably gonna buy all the series for them.These days it seems the world‘s gone crazy, dark, and terrible. This is a book about being light in the darkness. I love it.This has the flavor of Madeline L’Engle reborn.Relevant for kids. Right on the truth too. Close enough that you think it was written by somebody who was there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My daughter loved it.
reviews.reviewText: I handed this book to my daughter (12) on her way up to bed last night. She didn't come down this morning until noon because she'd stayed up late reading it, then picked it back up first thing when she woke up to finish it off. I asked her what she thought, and she immediately asked for the rest of the series. Sounds like a 5 star book to me!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good but confusing
reviews.reviewText: My 12 year old loves to read. She said that the book was good but a little confusing at times. She also said that it could be a bit scary for younger readers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars best first book
reviews.reviewText: Today was my first time using Amazon reader. It had me addicted to the story ! Thank you Amazon.Earlier, I had nothing to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Dream Come True
reviews.reviewText: Wow! What a riveting story. I have dreamt of a Christian fantasy and may have found it in this book series.I started reading this, as a 50+ yr old great aunt, to make sure it would be ok for my great niece to read and have ended up loving it myself! The characters are well rounded, the use of spiritual concepts so far are appropriate for youth and I appreciate that the parents and adults are mainly depicted as allies albeit protective. I hope this continues to be a book for young people that portrays parents and adults in harmony and protective authority over the youth in their sphere of influence. Cannot wait to read more. Excellent easy to read, and exciting adventure.So far, this will be on my Christmas list for a number of youth in my circle of friends and family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Character-driven teen/preteen story about angels. Christianity is definitely in there, but not pushy, just as the ground of Sheena’s life. Sheena is an interesting person, at once strong for justice and caring about others, while also flawed and human. Her relationships with other kids are also outside the usual mode: she sees the cliques at school very clearly but also feels she shares something with all of them. She has few friends but lots of people she interacts with, and cares a lot for the little boy next door, while also sometimes wishing he’d leave her alone. It’s a more balanced portrayal than most, and her emotions and reactions feel age-appropriate and right for who she is. The author walks a fine line very skillfully. My one con is the book feels a little slow. The mystery is introduced around the halfway point, which is a little late, and Sheena doesn’t really get much further than understanding there are unusual spiritual forces interested in her. I wish we’d gotten a fuller picture than that of what was happening before breaking for book two. I’ll read another one because I enjoy the author’s portrayal of Sheena, and hope that more happens in the next entry.A very small niggle that has nothing much to do with the story:A Vow of Purity ceremony (a promise by a young girl to stay chaste before marriage, made to her dad) is mentioned early on and I thought, as I always do: “Why don’t evangelical boys take the same Vow of Purity to their moms? Isn’t a boy’s purity expected to be just as much a part of his faith as a girl’s is? And what better way to help remind a boy to respect women than by having him make a vow to his mother?” Doubt it will happen, but I really wish those expectations and promises were more balanced. . .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023

reviews.reviewText: This book was purchased for our niece and she absolutely loved it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 11, 2022
reviews.reviewText: My 13yo daughter absolutely loved this story and has asked for more by the same author for Christmas. She said it was hard to put down!
It was a good read but again I wouldn’t read more than 1 chapter at a time.
Daughter loved this book, will be buying the rest of the series.
